alert.note: Alert for Dooly; Macon; Sumter (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 2:43PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Macon, western Dooly and northeastern Sumter Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 243 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Flint River Wma, or 7 miles south of Oglethorpe. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...40 mph wind and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Oglethorpe, Montezuma, Byromville, Andersonville, Lilly, Dooling, Whitewater State Park, New Era, Flint River Wma, Pennington, Andersonville National Historic, Drayton, Clearview, Methvins, and Bartlett. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
